author: @Rawi888
text: Hey Luke.  I ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve been up and down with my life. I did computer science, dropped out after a year to pursue a degree in business. Dropped out of that after 2 and a half years because I no longer had the funds required to continue. And now I‚Äôm back again doing computer science but I flunked the year. I just felt so overwhelmed, with childhood trauma creeping up, a failed relationship and overwhelming thoughts of just being a wasteful drag to society, it was hard to stay focused.  I‚Äôm in this limbo of making too many excuses and not forgiving myself.  If I stayed in computer science when I started, I would not only have finished my degree but could have been pursuing a MSc in data science by now (my new dream). I‚Äôm 23. I literally failed being a first year again.  All this stuff is ‚Ä¶ overwhelming, but god do I love it all. I just feel way to stupid and way to late.  Do you think its worth it for me to pursue this career (from the sounds of it) ?  By the time I finish graduating (if they aren‚Äôt any more set backs) I‚Äôll be 29-30, is that not too late or am I already putting roadblocks in my mind that don‚Äôt exist.  The fact that I can‚Äôt pass first year computer science (for the second time) doesn‚Äôt give me hope that I‚Äôd be remotely cut out for these hard hitting projects.  I don‚Äôt consider myself a loser but‚Ä¶ I feel like losing. I‚Äôm just kind of exhausted to continue living in a perpetual cycle of nothingness. Or should I fight through it all ? Once more, just‚Ä¶ PUSH AND PUSH AND PUSH.  I don‚Äôt know ‚Ä¶ (of course I‚Äôm not expecting you to tell me what to do with my life, but some advice would be warranted. For the time being, I‚Äôm looking for a job so I don‚Äôt feel like a total useless piece of garbage. So that I can start once more next year, and do it part time)
